item.title: Kody add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "That's what the world is , after all: an endless battle of contrasting memories." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Kody add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "I'm a very ordinary human being; I just happen to like reading books." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Kody add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Most people are not looking for provable truths. As you said, truth is often accompanied by intense pain, and almost no one is looking for painful truths. What people need is beautiful, comforting stories that make them feel as if their lives have some meaning. Which is where religion comes from." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Kody add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Aomame said, "It's like the Tibetan Wheel of the Passions. As the wheel turns, the values and feelings on the outer rim rise and fall, shining or sinking into darkness. But true love stays fastened to the axle and doesn't move." -- Haruki Murakami
